Annotation.String: The `OperatingSystem` schema represents the operating system and software running on a computer system.
This resource shall represent the operating system and software running on a computer system.
The status and health of the resource and its subordinate or dependent resources.
This property shall contain any status or health properties of the resource.
The type of operating system.
This property shall contain the type for this operating system.
The wall-clock time this operating system has been running in seconds.
This property shall contain the wall-clock time this operating system has been running in seconds.
The kernel information for this operating system.
This property shall contain the kernel information for this operating system.
The virtual machine engines running in this operating system.
This property shall contain the virtual machine engines running in this operating system.
The container engines running in this operating system.
This property shall contain the container engines running in this operating system.
The link to the collection of applications running under this operating system.
This property shall contain a link to a resource collection of type `ApplicationCollection` that represent the applications running under this operating system.
The link to the collection of container images available to container engines on this operating system.
This property shall contain a link to a resource collection of type `ContainerImageCollection` that represent the container images available to container engines on this operating system.
The link to the collection of containers running under this operating system.
This property shall contain a link to a resource collection of type `ContainerCollection` that represent the containers running under this operating system.
The links to other resources that are related to this resource.
This property shall contain links to resources that are related to but are not contained by, or subordinate to, this resource.
The available actions for this resource.
This property shall contain the available actions for this resource.
Microsoft Windows.
Oracle Solaris.
HPE HP-UX.
IBM AIX.
Berkeley Software Distribution.
Apple macOS.
IBM i.
A bare-metal hypervisor.
The kernel information for an operating system.
This type shall contain the kernel information for an operating system.
The name of the kernel.

This property shall contain the name of the kernel. For strict POSIX operating systems, the value shall contain the output of `uname -s`. For Microsoft Windows, the value shall contain the string name from the output of `ver`, from Command Prompt, prior to the first square brace (`[`), which is typically `Microsoft Windows`.
The release of the kernel.

This property shall contain the release of the kernel. For strict POSIX operating systems, the value shall contain the output of `uname -r`. For Microsoft Windows, the value shall contain the decimal-delimited version from the output of `ver`, from Command Prompt, within the square braces (`[` and `]`), following the regular expression `^\d+\.\d+\.\d+\.\d+$`.
The version of the kernel.
This property shall contain the version of the kernel. For strict POSIX operating systems, the value shall contain the output of `uname -v`.
The machine hardware name of the kernel.
This property shall contain the machine hardware name of the kernel. For strict POSIX operating systems, the value shall contain the output of `uname -m`.
A virtual machine engine running in an operating system.
This type shall contain a virtual machine engine running in an operating system.
The type of virtual machine engine.
This property shall contain the type for this virtual machine engine.
The version of this virtual machine engine.
This property shall contain the version of this virtual machine engine.
The supported image types for this container engine.
This property shall contain the supported image types for this container engine.
The URIs to manage this virtual machine engine.
This property shall contain an array of URIs to management interfaces for this virtual machine engine. This is typically a web UI or API provided by the virtual machine engine.
VMware ESX or ESXi.
This value shall indicate the virtual machine engine is VMware ESX or ESXi.
Microsoft Hyper-V.
This value shall indicate the virtual machine engine is Microsoft Hyper-V.
This value shall indicate the virtual machine engine is Xen.
KVM (Kernel-based Virtual Machine).
This value shall indicate the virtual machine engine is Linux KVM (Kernel-based Virtual Machine).
QEMU (Quick Emulator).

This value shall indicate the virtual machine engine is QEMU (Quick Emulator). If QEMU is acting as a frontend for another virtual machine engine, such as Xen or KVM, VirtualMachineEngines should contain additional entries to represent the backend virtual machine engines.
Oracle VM VirtualBox.

This value shall indicate the virtual machine engine is Oracle VM VirtualBox. If VirtualBox is acting as a frontend for another virtual machine engine, such as HyperV, VirtualMachineEngines should contain additional entries to represent the backend virtual machine engines.
IBM PowerVM.
This value shall indicate the virtual machine engine is IBM PowerVM.
Raw disk image.
This value shall indicate a raw disk image.
OVF (Open Virtualization Format).
This value shall indicate a DSP0243-defined OVF (Open Virtualization Format) image.
OVA (Open Virtual Appliance).
This value shall indicate a DSP0243-defined OVA (Open Virtual Appliance) image.
VHD (Virtual Hard Disk).
This value shall indicate a Microsoft Open Specification Promise-defined VHD (Virtual Hard Disk) image.
VMDK (Virtual Machine Disk).
This value shall indicate a VMware-defined VMDK (Virtual Machine Disk) image.
VDI (Virtual Disk Image).
This value shall indicate an Oracle VM VirtualBox-defined VDI (Virtual Disk Image).
QCOW (QEMU Copy-on-Write).
This value shall indicate a QEMU-defined QCOW (QEMU Copy-on-Write) image.
QCOW2 (QEMU Copy-on-Write version 2).
This value shall indicate a QEMU-defined QCOW2 (QEMU Copy-on-Write version 2) image.
A container engine running in an operating system.
This type shall contain a container engine running in an operating system.
The type of container engine.
This property shall contain the type for this container engine.
The version of this container engine.
This property shall contain the version of this container engine.
The supported image types for this container engine.
This property shall contain the supported image types for this container engine.
The URIs to manage this container engine.
This property shall contain an array of URIs to management interfaces for this container engine. This is typically a web UI or API provided by the container engine.
This value shall indicate the container engine is Docker.
This value shall indicate the container engine is containerd.
This value shall indicate the container engine is CRI-O.
The links to other resources that are related to this resource.
This Redfish Specification-described type shall contain links to resources that are related to but are not contained by, or subordinate to, this resource.
The link to the software image for this operating system.
This property shall contain a link to a resource of type `SoftwareInventory` that represents the software image from which this operating system runs.
The available actions for this resource.
This type shall contain the available actions for this resource.
The available OEM-specific actions for this resource.
This property shall contain the available OEM-specific actions for this resource.
The available OEM-specific actions for this resource.
This type shall contain the available OEM-specific actions for this resource.
This version was created to correct various typographical errors.
This version was created to force the regeneration of OpenAPI schemas to properly express nullable properties with external references. It was also created to correct various typographical errors.
